item.title: Complete Wreckreation Achievement List—How to Get All Achievements and Trophies
item.content:encoded:
Wreckreation is another spiritual successor to the beloved Burnout series, and now we know the full list of achievements and trophies.

With the game being one of 76 titles that Embracer Group is pushing, you would hope that there would be quite a bit of substance to it. Luckily, it does appear that you will have plenty of runway to enjoy the different aspects of this game.

Here is the full list of Wreckreation achievements and trophies.

Wreckreation Achievement and Trophy List

There are a total of 46 achievements in Wreckreation, which would make 47 trophies when you include the platinum. 

As of this writing, we do not know the name of the platinum, but we have the name criteria for unlocking every other trophy.

Burnout fans will notice quite a few similarities with Wreckreation when they read the achievement list above. For example, Road Rage is a mode that originated in that series and involves you forcing the opposition to crash while speeding down the road.

Those similarities are not surprising, though, as the development team for Wreckreation, Three Fields Entertainment, is made up of members from the original iteration of Criterion, who made the Burnout series that EA has completely forgotten about these days. They have developed Danger Zone and Dangerous Driving, which obviously have a lot of Burnout energy in them, and you see that even more now with Wreckreation.

Do you think you can get all achievements and trophies in Wreckreation? Let us know in the comments or on the Insider Gaming forum.

Wreckreation isn’t the only game that had its achievement list revealed recently. You can also see the full list for The Outer Worlds 2 and Jurassic World Evolution 3.

item.title: Banjo-Kazooie Co-Creator Leaves Rare After 36 Years
item.content:encoded:
Gregg Mayles, one of Rare’s longest-serving workers and co-creator of Banjo-Kazooie, is resigning from the company.

The legacy of Rare in the 1990s is beyond incredible. From massive hits like Battletoads and Banjo-Kazooie to Goldeneye and Donkey Kong Country, there was no studio quite like them. After being bought by Microsoft/Xbox in 2002, the company’s track record went a bit low, with success being less and less. Unfortunately, despite Sea of Thieves’ reputation, the recent cancellation of Everwild has left many dejected, with its director and former creative director now jumping ship.

Gregg Mayles, Co-Creator of Banjo-Kazooie, Resigns From Rare After Everwild Cancellation

In a post on Twitter/X, Gregg Mayles announced his retirement from Rare. True to his form, his message is done in rhymes and can be seen above. For many, he crafted people’s childhoods in more ways than one. Mayles, as previously mentioned, co-created Banjo-Kazooie with his brother Steve Mayles at Rare. In addition, Mayles was responsible for designing games like Viva Pinata, Donkey Kong Country, Sea of Thieves, and Kinect Sports. He had also been Rare’s longest-serving worker, starting as a designer, director, and later studio creative director.

Sadly, his final piece of work would’ve been Rare’s Everwild, which he directed and designed. The title was canceled alongside Project Blackbird and Perfect Dark. Just last week, screenshots of the game emerged, giving us a glimpse as to what could’ve been. With many of the original talents of Rare gone, the studio’s future is a bit uncertain, so hopefully, good will come. Though, with fans hungry for a new Banjo-Kazooie title, the news isn’t the most favorable.

What do you think about Gregg Mayles leaving Rare? Did you play Banjo-Kazooie? What was your favorite game he worked on? Let us know in the comments, Let us know in the comments, forums, and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more on Xbox, check out our articles on Perfect Dark’s almost revival and the removal of DLC discounts. Don’t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Summer Game Fest 2026 Date Announced As Show Gets New Venue
item.content:encoded:
Summer Game Fest will return for another show in 2026, and its official date and new venue have been confirmed.

In a post on social media on Tuesday, organizer Geoff Keighley announced that the annual summer gaming showcase will take place on Friday, June 5, 2026. This year, however, the show will be taking place at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, California.

Keighley says that the show will be a “spectacular, cross-platform showcase of what’s next in video games.” The show also promises, as expected, brand new video game announcements and reveals.

Summer Game Fest 2025 took place on June 6, 2025, at the YouTube Theater in Inglewood, California. The show had spent the last three years at the venue since it began producing in-person events. This year’s show featured reveals such as Lego Voyagers, Deadpool VR, Dying Light: The Beast, and Resident Evil: Requiem, among others.

Tickets for Summer Game Fest 2026 will go on sale in Spring 2026.

What are you hoping to see from Summer Game Fest 2026? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about the head of Assassin’s Creed leaving Ubisoft after 20 years with the company. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1579: Hints And Answer For October 15, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1579 for October 15, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There currently isn’t an app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 15, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1579 is going to present a challenge for most players. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.8 guesses out of 6 to get. That makes it slightly harder than October 14’s 4.4-guess average.

General Wordle Hints For October 15

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word contains a repeated vowel.
  • Hint 2: It starts with S.
  • Hint 3: It means to trick or deceive someone.
  • Hint 4: It can also describe something lightheartedly exaggerated or playful

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1579 for October 15, 2025

Starter Words For October 15, 2025

If you just want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • SCOPE
  • FOCUS
  • POOFY

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1579 On October 15, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: SPOOF

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1578 on October 14, 2025:

Answer: FORUM

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1579?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 16 will be Wordle Game #1580.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below.

item.title: The Outer Worlds 2 Release Date Explained—Exact Start Times Explained
item.content:encoded:
The Outer Worlds 2 release is nearly here, bringing many people who loved the original game back into this universe where business executives overrule everyone.

With the embargo date set to reveal review scores for the upcoming game, you will want to have a good understanding of when the game is actually released so you can play it.

Here is everything we know about The Outer Worlds 2 release date and a possible start time.

When Does The Outer Worlds 2 Release?

The Outer Worlds 2 full release date is on October 29, but anyone who pre-orders the Premium Edition will be able to play the game five days early on October 24.

Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers will be able to download and play the game on that later date, but if they desire to play early and get all the rest of the content included in the Premium Edition, they can buy the $30 upgrade pack on the Xbox Store.

It might not be the perfect festive game for Halloween, but fans of the first game will hardly complain about being able to run around and mess with the various corporations and NPCs just before the holiday.

Do We Know the Exact Release Time for The Outer Worlds 2?

According to the PlayStation Store, the standard edition of The Outer Worlds 2 will go live at 1 PM ET on October 29, so this version of the game will not have a midnight release. That is not the same for the early access players, who will be able to play starting at 12 AM ET on October 24.

Here is a chart that will break down the starting times for the standard version of The Outer Worlds 2.

The standard edition of The Outer Worlds 2 releasing at midday in the United States is definitely an odd time for the full game to release. Usually, even with games that have an early access period, they will become playable at either midnight Eastern Time or sometime in the morning. Having it set for the afternoon is definitely not the norm with big releases like this.

Are you setting aside time to dive into The Outer Worlds 2 at launch? Let us know in the comments or on the Insider Gaming forum.

As we approach the release of The Outer Worlds 2, check out the achievement and trophy list for the game. Here is also the preload guide that includes the file size for the game before launch.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
